result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey E. Blanchette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, DNA surcharge and $15 payment plan fee at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 3/1/16.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge with payment plan noted in Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Casey E. Blanchette in court, in custody with attorney Ramneek Singh Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; State notes that restitution packet has been sent to victim with no response; Court reviews recomm.; victim rights complied with; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Retail Theft in Count 1 and Obstructing in Count 2; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Retail Theft in Count 1 and Obstructing in Count 2; State heard; Atty. Button heard; Def. is on PO hold which may be lifted; Def. heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

Count 1: Retail Theft
* $200 F+C = $515.00 plus $15PPF at rate of $25/mo. comm. 3/1/16 (Def. is unemployed)
* $200 DNA surcharge and sample

Count 2: Obstructing
* $243 CC w/PP above
* $200 DNA surcharge
Defendant shall not go on the premises at Recheks, Beaver Dam WI.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

1:00 - Defendant Casey E. Blanchette in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not go on the premises at Recheks, 609 N Spring St, Beaver Dam.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Return date scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
